localFacts.description: Los Angeles, the entertainment capital of the world, is home to Hollywood and world-famous beaches.
San Diego is known for its mild year-round climate, beautiful beaches, and proximity to the Mexican border.
San Jose is the capital of Silicon Valley and home to major technology companies.
San Francisco is known for its iconic Golden Gate Bridge, cable cars, and vibrant culture.
Fresno is the agricultural hub of California's Central Valley, gateway to Yosemite and Sequoia National Parks.
Sacramento is California's capital city, known for its historic Old Town and farm-to-fork dining.
Long Beach is a major port city known for the historic Queen Mary and vibrant waterfront.
Oakland is a diverse city across the Bay from San Francisco, known for arts and culture.
Bakersfield is an oil and agriculture center in California's southern Central Valley.
Anaheim is home to the world-famous Disneyland Resort and major sports venues.
Santa Ana is the county seat of Orange County and a cultural center with rich Hispanic heritage.
Riverside is the birthplace of California's citrus industry and home to the historic Mission Inn.
Stockton is a major inland port city in California's Central Valley with a rich history.
Irvine is a master-planned city known for its safety, excellent schools, and tech companies.
Chula Vista is San Diego's second-largest city, located near the Mexican border.
Fremont is a tech hub in the East Bay, home to Tesla's factory and diverse communities.
San Bernardino is the county seat and gateway to the San Bernardino Mountains.
Modesto is an agricultural center known for its famous arch with the motto 'Water, Wealth, Contentment, Health.'
Fontana is home to the Auto Club Speedway and has grown from a steel town to a thriving city.
Moreno Valley is one of the fastest-growing cities in the Inland Empire with military history.
Glendale is a diverse city known for its Armenian community and upscale shopping.
Huntington Beach is known as 'Surf City USA' for its world-class surfing and beaches.
Santa Clarita is home to Six Flags Magic Mountain and the iconic Vasquez Rocks.
Ontario is a logistics and retail hub with a major international airport in the Inland Empire.
Rancho Cucamonga is a master-planned community with excellent shopping and mountain views.
Houston is the largest city in Texas, home to NASA's Johnson Space Center and world-class museums.
San Antonio is famous for the historic Alamo and beautiful River Walk in the heart of Texas.
Dallas is a major business hub known for its modern skyline, arts district, and rich history.
Austin is the Live Music Capital of the World and Texas's tech-focused capital city.
Fort Worth combines Western heritage with world-class museums in the Cultural District.
El Paso is a border city with rich Mexican-American culture and stunning mountain views.
Arlington is the entertainment capital of DFW, home to the Cowboys and Rangers stadiums.
Corpus Christi is the 'Sparkling City by the Sea' with beautiful beaches and coastal charm.
Plano is a prosperous suburb north of Dallas, home to many corporate headquarters.
Lubbock is the 'Hub City' of West Texas and home to Texas Tech University.

landmarks: Republic of the Rio Grande Museum
localFacts.description: Laredo is a major international trade hub on the US-Mexico border with rich heritage.
Irving is home to Las Colinas, DFW Airport, and major corporate headquarters.
Garland is a diverse suburb east of Dallas with family-friendly attractions.
Frisco is one of America's fastest-growing cities with top-rated sports facilities.
McKinney has a charming historic downtown and was named the best place to live in America.
Amarillo is the heart of the Texas Panhandle, known for Route 66 and Palo Duro Canyon.
Grand Prairie offers family entertainment with Epic Waters and major shopping destinations.
Brownsville is at the southern tip of Texas, near South Padre Island and SpaceX operations.
Killeen is home to Fort Cavazos (formerly Fort Hood), one of the largest military bases.
Pasadena is home to the San Jacinto Monument and the petrochemical industry along the Ship Channel.
Denton is a vibrant college town known for its music scene and historic downtown square.
Midland is the heart of the Permian Basin oil industry and where George W. Bush grew up.
Carrollton has a charming historic downtown and excellent connectivity to DFW.
Waco is home to Baylor University and Magnolia Market, drawing visitors from across the country.
Odessa is the Friday Night Lights city, known for high school football and oil industry.
